reviewText: This is an inspirational documentary on an outstanding young man who learns there's more to live for than sports!  The close family relationships and moral values portrayed are heartwarming and uplifting.  Excellent film enjoyed by my sons and daughter alike!

I am a retired teacher and used this video in my class for years.  My 5th and 6th grade students loved it and certainly learned something from it.  The kids often took it home for their parents to watch.  Tyler is an amazing young man with a story many people need to think about.  "You play the cards you are dealt".  His adjustment to his car accident is very inspiring to all of us.

A very special true story of a spectacular athlete, glimpses of his character in youth, & his determination in overcoming great odds.  But it's also a very sweet love story of the girl who's stayed & believed in Tyler.  An excellent film for the family & all needing encouragement not to give up.
Tyler is from So. Utah.  His story is amazing and I don't want to give too much away.  This is a great family story and although a little older, it would be great viewing for teens.  Very inspiring!!
